plussz~.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /**
00002     @file
00003     plussz~: a very simple example of a basic MSP obejct 
00004 
00005     @ingroup    examples    
00006 */
00007 
00008 #include "ext.h"
00009 #include "z_dsp.h"
00010 
00011 void *plus_class;
00012 
00013 typedef struct _plus
00014 {
00015     t_pxobject x_obj;
00016     t_float x_val;
00017 } t_plus;
00018 
00019 void *plus_new(double val);
00020 t_int *offset_perform(t_int *w);
00021 t_int *plus2_perform(t_int *w);
00022 void plus_float(t_plus *x, double f);
00023 void plus_int(t_plus *x, long n);
00024 void plus_dsp(t_plus *x, t_signal **sp, short *count);
00025 void plus_assist(t_plus *x, void *b, long m, long a, char *s);
00026 
00027 int main(void)
00028 {
00029     setup((t_messlist **)&plus_class, (method)plus_new, (method)dsp_free, (short)sizeof(t_plus), 0L, A_DEFFLOAT, 0);
00030     
00031     addmess((method)plus_dsp, "dsp", A_CANT, 0);    // respond to the dsp message 
00032                                                     // (sent to MSP objects when audio is turned on/off)
00033     addfloat((method)plus_float);
00034     addint((method)plus_int);
00035     addmess((method)plus_assist,"assist",A_CANT,0);
00036     dsp_initclass();                                // must call this function for MSP object classes
00037     return 0;
00038 }
00039 
00040 void plus_assist(t_plus *x, void *b, long m, long a, char *s)
00041 {
00042     if (m == ASSIST_INLET) {
00043         switch (a) {    
00044         case 0:
00045             sprintf(s,"(Signal) This + Right Inlet");
00046             break;
00047         case 1:
00048             sprintf(s,"(Signal) Left Inlet + This");
00049             break;
00050         }
00051     } else
00052         sprintf(s,"(Signal) Addition Result");
00053 }
00054 
00055 void *plus_new(double val)
00056 {
00057     t_plus *x = (t_plus *)newobject(plus_class);
00058     dsp_setup((t_pxobject *)x,2);                   // set up DSP for the instance and create signal inlets
00059     outlet_new((t_pxobject *)x, "signal");          // signal outlets are created like this
00060     x->x_val = val;
00061     return (x);
00062 }
00063 
00064 void plus_float(t_plus *x, double f)                // the float and int routines cover both inlets. 
00065 {                                                   // It doesn't matter which one is involved
00066     x->x_val = f;
00067 }
00068 
00069 void plus_int(t_plus *x, long n)
00070 {
00071     x->x_val = (float)n;
00072 }
00073 
00074 t_int *offset_perform(t_int *w)                     // our perform method if one signal inlet is connected
00075 {
00076     t_float *in = (t_float *)(w[1]);
00077     t_float *out = (t_float *)(w[2]);
00078     t_plus *x = (t_plus *)(w[3]);
00079     float val = x->x_val;
00080     int n = (int)(w[4]);
00081     
00082     if (x->x_obj.z_disabled)
00083         goto out;
00084     
00085     while (--n) *++out = val + *++in; 
00086 out:
00087     return (w+5);
00088 }
00089 
00090 t_int *plus2_perform(t_int *w)                      // our perform method if both signal inlets are connected
00091 {
00092     t_float *in1,*in2,*out;
00093     int n;
00094 
00095     if (*(long *)(w[1]))                            // just doing this a different way for some variation
00096         goto out;
00097 
00098     in1 = (t_float *)(w[2]);
00099     in2 = (t_float *)(w[3]);
00100     out = (t_float *)(w[4]);
00101     n = (int)(w[5]);
00102     
00103     while (--n) *++out = *++in1 + *++in2; 
00104 out:
00105     return (w+6);
00106 }       
00107 
00108 void plus_dsp(t_plus *x, t_signal **sp, short *count)   // method called when dsp is turned on
00109 {
00110     if (!count[0])
00111         dsp_add(offset_perform, 4, sp[1]->s_vec-1, sp[2]->s_vec-1, x, sp[0]->s_n+1);
00112     else if (!count[1])
00113         dsp_add(offset_perform, 4, sp[0]->s_vec-1, sp[2]->s_vec-1, x, sp[0]->s_n+1);
00114     else
00115         dsp_add(plus2_perform, 5, &x->x_obj.z_disabled, sp[0]->s_vec-1, sp[1]->s_vec-1, sp[2]->s_vec-1, sp[0]->s_n+1);
00116 }
